choices.text:
the partition of the country after it gained its independence in 1960. On one hand, the northern region became part of Nigeria, while on the other, the southern region was united with West Cameroon thereby creating two different countries, known as the Federal Republic of Cameroon and the Republic of Southern Cameroun. This section will give a background of this division.

Background to Separation

There is a historical background to the creation of the Federal Republic of Cameroon and the Republic of South-west Cameroon. They were basically areas of European control until an independence referendum was held in 1955. Fourteen days later, on June 30, 1960, both regions gained their independence. The then United Nations (UN) led negotiations for arrangements for the independence of the then Cameroon.

Independence

It was a time of excitement and gladness. The south west was awash with celebrations and the old flag was flying. Nonetheless, in the northern section, there were fears of a change of a new dawn or sense of rejoicing. This is due to the uncertainty who would be in charge, and how would the people survive. The north withdrew from the celebration and no song was to be heard; just a silence with a sense of insecurity. This division was due to the insult cause by some judges who asked the southern Cameroonian to sing the same national anthem as did Southern Cameroonians. This request was seen as a symbol of an extension of the humiliation they had suffered during the colonisation.
